duties_responsibilities.duty: Oversee clinical operations, using data and fact-based problem solving techniques to improve processes and outcomes.
Manage staff recruitment, training, coaching, evaluation, and disciplinary procedures in accordance with policies and procedures.
Develop, maintain, and reconcile departmental budget with financial responsibility and oversight for department or division.
Coordinate educational and performance improvement activities within a designated clinical specialty.
Establish and implement short and long term goals, objectives, policies, and operating procedures for high level of performance in nursing care delivery.
Maintain readiness for Joint Commission and other agency surveys, and present related programs during visits.
Participate in the performance appraisal process of designated Nursing staff.
Prepare reports and analysis associated with orientation of new hires, ongoing competency, and evaluation of staff performance.

Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies.

education_certification.credential: Baccalaureate Degree in Nursing is required. Masters in Nursing or health related field is preferred. Certification in specialty area preferred. 5 years directly related experience (some supervisory preferred) New York State License with current registration as a registered professional nurse.
